runs.comm: short and wide and Levi misses out really, swinging and missing
another little fiddle outside off, this time more back of a length, moving away outside off
shorter again, smash down the ground for four past mid off, that was thumped hard
thumped again, this time more conventionally past mid on, but another poor short ball really, Levi was onto it very quickly
fuller now, driven off an inside edge to short fine leg
forward and blocked to mid off
full and punched out to mid on
hard drive to mid off on the front foot
length ball, driven off an outside edge in the air through maybe where gully might have been, down to third man

well here's the breakthrough, a length ball outside off and Levi has chopped it to slip trying to cut away without moving his feet, didn't really got that hard at it, bit of a fiddle again and nicked off
too straight and tucked through midwicket
full and chipped in the air but inside mid on, it runs away for two
full and an edge to first slip, did this carry to Hales coming forward, not quite, it was a tentative push forward from Kallis and a thick nick but fell short of the fielder
angled in to the stumps, blocked staying in the crease around middle and off
short, width offered, cut down to third man

full and plumb in front, lbw as du Plessis is trapped right in front trying to drive, it was another ball angled into the pads and this catches the bottom of the front pad of du Plessis and he also fails like Bopara, was going on to smash middle and leg stumps
played back and blocked in the crease
back of a length, mis-cut towards point
back of a length, too close to cut, takes a big outside edge that flies over the slip for four, fortunate
length ball, firm push just wide of mid off to allow a single
oh that is an incredible shot. Back of a length and timed to absolute perfection past extra cover, that is so so good
fuller now and he's not all that forward, squirting a drive through cover point for a couple
slower ball, waited for and hammered past point for four, read it and punished it

but now de Villiers edges to the keeper. He drove without moving his feet really and got a thin edge through to Kieswetter, a good length ball and de Villiers in unnecessarily trying to force it through the off side has perished, didn't need to do that really
forward and carefully dropped into midwicket for a sharp single
full length just outside off, it swings back but only after Duminy had shouldered arms, very well left
tries to play this one and gets beaten for pace, excellent length and it flies through as Duminy tried to back foot drive
but this is too wide and Duminy helps it past extra cover, very well timed but just a hint of width allowed him to feel his arms
full, sliding past the off stump, left alone
similar delivery, left alone again
full on middle stump, turned to leg
similar line, again tucked through midwicket with a little shuffle across the stumps
length ball, careful drive back to the bowler
too leg side, actually gets away with it because the short long leg was up the circle, came off the thigh pad to the fielder
dabbed fine from outside off, lovely angled stroke past where second slip would have been, it runs all the way for four, lovely touch
nice-looking drive on the front foot but straight to point
leg side wide, superbly taken from Kieswetter who's up to the stumps, saved four there
outside off, slapped to short extra cover without timing it
back of a length, worked through square leg
darts in a little and strikes Kallis on the pad
super shot, just wide of off stump and lashed past point, runs between third man and deep cover
and now too straight, tucked to the long leg fence
short and wide and point fields, bailing Bopara out because that should have gone for four again
little short, cut towards cover, no run
floated up and driven down to long on
across the stumps and clipped with the spin to leg
forward and blocked around middle and off
floated up fuller, nudged in front of long on, just a single
tossed up, goes to flick to leg again, struck on the pad, cry for lbw but Kallis was outside the line
full ball outside off, Duminy pushes at it and misses
bumper now, well directed and well ducked
short again, Duminy goes to cut and gets a bottom edge on the bounce to the keeper
off stump line, back of a length, angled down to third man
full and swinging slightly away from the drive, Kallis beaten
length ball, dabbed into the off side
around the wicket, Duminy forward, struck on the front pad trying to play to leg, it was going down
across the stumps, tucked past short fine leg, Patel scrambles to the long leg fence
tuck inside midwicket for a single
down the pitch and played against the spin out to deep midwicket
full ball and again played with the spin out to deep midwicket
back and cut out through cover to the deep fielder
full toss outside odd and Duminy reverse the bat and slaps it through point for four
paddled fine this time, again reverse swept, with a little tap on the behind as the ball scooted by to take it for four
spinning in from outside off, turned to backward square leg
round the wicket, tossed up on off, played back to the bowler
flighted, sliding down the leg side, worked round the corner
length ball, straightening on off, goes back and pushes to long-on
flighted from Swann, Duminy advances but doesn't get to the pitch and the ball beats the bat but deflects away off the back leg
tossed up outside off and played through cover-point on the front foot
spinning in from outside off, hit on the front pad and Swann appeals loudly, looked pretty close but umpire Illingworth turns him down
on the stumps, pushed down the ground to long-on
flighted outside the line of off, pushed into the covers
chipped out towards long-off, Bairstow comes round and hits with his throw at the bowler's end ... but Kallis was safe
full and outside the line of off, punched to extra-cover
back of a length, touch wide and Kallis leans back and angles the ball down to third man

pitched up well outside off, Duminy opens the face and squirts it wide of the slips for four ... Fin clipped the stumps at the non-striker's end and both he and Broad seem to enquire politely why it wasn't called dead ball
length ball on the pads, flicked down to long leg
angling in, back of a length outside off, turned short of midwicket
length delivery, pushed across, steered through gully to the man in the deep
pushed through, going on with the arm towards middle and off, Duminy defends on to the pitch from right back in front of the stumps
length ball on the stumps again, played back to the bowler
goes back and flicks through the leg side
tossed up outside off, spinning in and Kallis misses with a glance, hit on the pad and it rolls square - he was outside the line this time
flighted, straightening outside off, goes back and chops into the ground towards point
looping off break, drifting in towards leg stump, swept confidently to deep backward square leg

back of a length and pulled through midwicket, the throw comes in and spits off an old cut strip on the square and nearly has Kieswetter's eye out, the ball hitting him on the shoulder as he takes evasive action
back of a length outside off, chopped straight to point on the back foot
dug in, Kallis begins to advances, then jerks out of the way and hooks almost blind through midwicket
steered through gully, third man has to run around and they get two
good length, around the line of off, driven to mid-off
full, inswinging yorker, good delivery but well kept out by Duminy, who gets his bat down in time, the ball rolls away from the stumps and they scramble one
full and outside the line of off, driven through the infield
full, tailing in towards middle and leg, Kallis drives loosely and the bat turns in his hands, the ball flying through midwicket
short ball, tries to pull but the ball deflects into the off side via bat and pad
slightly full of a length, outside off, punched to cover on the half-volley
goes back and steers one to third man
slow legcutter out the back of the hand ... Kallis waits ... lazy swing of the bat ... and it disappears through cover for four
bounces him, this climbs above Duminy, who doesn't play at it - that'll be Broad's one for the over
pitched up outside the line of off, driven to mid-off
full and around the line of off, driven into the ground and through a gap at cover
and now Kallis decides to move things along, hefting a full ball over mid-on and away for four
goes back and pulls a short ball through square leg
length ball on leg stump, cramps Duminy for room and he blocks down on to the pitch, Broad fields in his follow-through
full toss, out the back of the hand, I think, Kallis sweeps it business-like for four
length ball, on the stumps, tickled down the ground to long-on
chopped through the covers to the sweeper
round the wicket, length ball, tucks Duminy up and he turns to midwicket
sliding down the leg side, flicks to long leg off the hips
full and punched to midwicket, there's a misfield and they take one
feisty bouncer, angled across from wide on the crease, Duminy ducks it
touch short, on the body, nudged to long leg
pitched up, Kallis chops a half-volley into the ground and it loops over Dernbach's head, Broad fields at mid-off and misses the stumps, a direct hit would have had Kallis struggling
good length, on leg stump, pinged through square to the man on the fence
full and outside off, half-driven back down the pitch, Dernbach stops it with his foot

full length again, big swing into the ground, probably would have snapped the old bat at the handle, it squeezes out to short third man and that'll do it, the throw misses and South Africa have won by seven wickets
